template.name: Template Net Fortinet FortiGate SNMPv2
template.description:
Zabbix Template for Fortinet FortiGate URL: https://github.com/barbosm/fortinet-zabbix Author: Michel Barbosa Version: 1.3
Exposes information obtained from the following MIBs (import is not required): - FORTINET-CORE-MIB - FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB

item.name: Logical Description
item.description:
ENTITY-MIB::entLogicalDescr
A textual description of the logical entity. This object should contain a string which identifies the manufacturer's name for the logical entity, and should be set to a distinct value for each version of the logical entity.

item.name: Physical Description
item.description:
ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr
A textual description of physical entity. This object should contain a string which identifies the manufacturer's name for the physical entity, and should be set to a distinct value for each version or model of the physical entity.

item.name: HA Config Sync
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaAutoSync
Configuration of an automatic configuration synchronization (enabled or disabled)

item.name: HA Cluster Group ID
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaSystemMode
HA cluster group ID device is configured for

item.name: HA Cluster Name
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaGroupName
HA cluster group name

item.name: HA Cluster Master Override
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaOverride
Status of a master override flag

item.name: HA Cluster Priority
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaPriority
HA clustering priority of the device (default = 128)

item.name: HA Load-balancing Schedule
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaSchedule
Load-balancing schedule of cluster (in A-A mode)

item.name: HA Mode
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaSystemMode
High-availability mode (Standalone, A-A or A-P)

item.name: Intrusions detected - Anomaly based
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsAnomalyDetections
Number of intrusions detected by signature since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected - Critical
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsCritSevDetections
Number of critical severity intrusions detected since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected - High
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsHighSevDetections
Number of high severity intrusions detected since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected - Info
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsInfoSevDetections
Number of informational severity intrusions detected since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions blocked
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsIntrusionsBlocked
Number of intrusions blocked since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsIntrusionsDetected
Number of intrusions detected since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected - Low
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsLowSevDetections
Number of low severity intrusions detected since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected - Medium
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsMedSevDetections
Number of medium severity intrusions detected since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: Intrusions detected - Signature based
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgIpsSignatureDetections
Number of intrusions detected by signature since start-up in this virtual domain

item.name: CPU usage
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysCpuUsage
Current CPU usage (percentage)

trigger.name: High CPU usage (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item.name: Hard Disk Capacity
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysDiskCapacity
Total hard disk capacity (MB), if disk is present

item.name: Hard Disk Usage
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysDiskUsage
Current hard disk usage (MB), if disk is present

item.name: Hard Disk Usage Rate
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysDiskUsage
Current hard disk usage (MB), if disk is present

item.name: Memory usage
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysMemUsage
Current memory utilization (percentage)

trigger.name: High memory usage ( >{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

item.name: IPv4 Active sessions
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysSesCount
Number of active sessions on the device

item.name: FortiGate Uptime
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysUpTime
The 64bit time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: Firmware Version
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysVersion
Firmware version of the device

item.name: IPS Database Version
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysVersionIps
IPS signature database version installed on the device

item.name: IPS Database Version - Extended
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysVersionIpsEt
IPS signature extended database version installed on the device

item.name: SSL VPN state
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVpnSslState
Whether SSL-VPN is enabled on this virtual domain

item.name: Active SSL VPN users
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVpnSslStatsLoginUsers
The current number of users logged in through SSL-VPN tunnels in the virtual domain

item.name: Active IPsec VPN tunnels
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVpnTunnelUpCount
The number of IPsec VPN tunnels with at least one SA

item.name: Device Serial Number
item.description:
FORTINET-CORE-MIB::fnSysSerial
Device serial number. This is the same serial number as given in the ENTITY-MIB tables for the base entity.
If in HA returns the master SN only.

item.name: Operating System
item.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgSysVersion
Firmware version of the device

discovery_rule.name: High Availability Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsTable
Some useful statistics for all members of a cluster. This table is also available in standalone mode.

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - AV Events Rate
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsAvCount
Number of anti-virus events triggered on the specified cluster member since start-up

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Bytes Processed Rate
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsByteCount
Number of bytes processed by the specified cluster member since start-up

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - CPU Usage
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsCpuUsage
CPU usage of the specified cluster member (percentage)

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Global Checksum
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsGlobalChecksum
Current HA global checksum value

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Hostname
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsHostname
Host name of the specified cluster member

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - IPS Events Rate
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsIdsCount
Number of IDS/IPS events triggered on the specified cluster member since start-up

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Master SN
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsMasterSerial
Serial number of master during the last synch attempt (successful of not)

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Memory Usage
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsMemUsage
Memory usage of the specified cluster member (percentage)

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Network Bandwidth Usage
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsNetUsage
Network bandwidth usage of specified cluster member (kbps)

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Packets Processed Rate
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsPktCount
Number of packets processed by the specified cluster member since start-up

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Serial Number
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsSerial
Serial number of the HA cluster member

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Concurrent Connections
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsSesCount
Current session count of specified cluster member

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Sync Success Time
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsSyncDatimeSucc
Date and time of last successful sync

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Sync Failed Time
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsSyncDatimeUnsucc
Date and time of last unsuccessful sync

item_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Sync Status
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgHaStatsSyncStatus
Current HA Sync status

graph_prototype.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Network Bandwidth Usage
HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Security Events Rate

discovery_rule.name: CPU Cores Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorEntIndex
A unique identifier within the fgProcessorTable

item_prototype.name: Average Usage of System Process over 1min per Core #{#CPU_ID}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorSysUsage
The processor's CPU system space usage, which is an average calculated over the last minute. (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: Core #{#CPU_ID} Processor Type
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorType
An indication of the type of the processor. Types are defined in fgProcessorTypes.

item_prototype.name: Average Usage over 1min per Core #{#CPU_ID}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorUsage
The processor's CPU usage (percentage), which is an average calculated over the last minute. (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: Average Usage over 5sec per Core #{#CPU_ID}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorUsage5sec
The processor's CPU usage (percentage), which is an average calculated over the last 5 sec. (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: Average Usage of User Process over 1min per Core #{#CPU_ID}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorUserUsage
The processor's CPU user space usage, which is an average calculated over the last minute. (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

graph_prototype.name: Average Usage over 1m and 5s per Core - Core #{#CPU_ID}

discovery_rule.name: SoC3 Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorEntIndex
A unique identifier within the fgProcessorTable

item_prototype.name: SOC3 Packets Dropped
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorPktDroppedCount
The total number of packets dropped by this processor (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: SOC3 Packets Received
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorPktRxCount
The total number of packets received by this processor (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: SOC3 Packets Transmitted
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgProcessorPktTxCount
The total number of packets transmitted by this processor (only valid for processors types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: Available Bidirectional Bandwidth of Performance SLA {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkBandwidthBi
The available bandwidth in Mbps of bi-direction traffic detected by a health-check on a specific member link.

item_prototype.name: Available Incoming Bandwidth of Performance SLA {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkBandwidthIn
The available bandwidth in Mbps of incoming traffic detected by a health-check on a specific member link.

item_prototype.name: Available Outgoing Bandwidth of Performance SLA {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkBandwidthOut
The available bandwidth in Mbps of outgoing traffic detected by a health-check on a specific member link.

item_prototype.name: Jitter to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
Latency to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
Packet Loss to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
Packets received from {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkPacketRecv
The total number of packets received by a health check on a specific member link.

item_prototype.name: Packets sent to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkPacketSend
The total number of packets sent by a health check on a specific member link.

item_prototype.name: Health Check State to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkState
Heatlth check state on a specific member link.

item_prototype.name: VDOM of Performance SLA {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
item_prototype.description:
FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB::fgVWLHealthCheckLinkVdom
Virtual domain the link monitor entry exists in. This name corresponds to the fgVdEntName used in fgVdTable.

graph_prototype.name: Performance SLA Metrics to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
Probe Packets to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}

resource.name: HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Network Bandwidth Usage
HA Cluster Member {#HA_ID} - Security Events Rate
Performance SLA Metrics to {#HC_NAME} on SD-WAN member {#MEMBER_SEQ}
